reviewText: i grew up in the 70's and watched every disaster movie that came out and this T.V. movie was fun back then. to be sure this isn't a great movie, but if you like disaster movies you may like this slice of cheese.
summary: OK disaster movie for T.V. but only if your a fan

reviewText: Flood is excellent: it shows what happens when people ignore warn signs and expert reports.A dam made out of earth (dirt,rocks)is starting to fall apart and could cause A real threat to A town and people living there.One man things it will bust,and another the msyor believes safe and nothing will happen.Well then  we all know what happens next.

reviewText: I already have this movie on VHS.  It's a good "disaster" movie with an all star cast.  But over the years, I've watched the VHS one so many times that it's wearing out.  So I bought it on DVD.  Hopefully, it will last even longer.  I would definitely recommend it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Irwin Allen was a real showman...the P.T. Barnum of disaster movies!  But after his TV success and subsequent big-screen hits like THE POSEIDON ADVENTURE and THE TOWERING INFERNO, he should have quit while he was ahead.  In this boring, low budget TV movie, he brings together lots of his favorite players (Lynley, McDowall, Hershey, Milner) and gets them all wet.  Strictly for fans.
summary: Irwin should have quit while he was ahead!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The VHS on the movie "FLOOD" is just great. Robert Culp and Martin Milner are two of my favorite actors. I saw this movie on TV a few years ago and I wanted to have it in my movie collection.  I am so grateful I was able to order it at Amazon.Thanks a billion!B. Walpool

reviewText: It was a good movie. It could have used more special effects and less drama. The lives of the characters should have been more interwoven with the flood more. Maybe if the flood had happened earlier in the movie?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Just like Irwin Allen's other all-star made for t.v. disaster movie FIRE,FLOOD is an exciting,action packed thrill ride!The charactersare interesting and well-developed,unlike most of today's summer blockbusters.And since the movie is made for television,the specialeffects are quite impressive for that era!And with only one curseword in the entire film,NO WONDER THEY WON'T SHOW ANYTHING LIKETHIS ON T.V. ANYMORE!
summary: Fun disaster movie that the entire family can enjoy!!!!!!

reviewText: Another Classic Action Movie from the Master of Disaster Irwin Allen. Too much water has to go somewhere, even when a town is in the way! His other Classics include Fire, The Swarm (Killer Bees), The Poseidon Adventure, and TV Series Swiss Family Robinsion (1975-76).
